blocks.text: Security controls are often described using both a category and a type. For example, a firewall rule is both a technical control and a preventive control.

The same control type can appear in different categories. For instance, a deterrent control may be technical (login banners), managerial (disciplinary policies), operational (reception staff), or physical (warning signs).
Understanding this matrix helps security teams design layered protections and avoid over-reliance on a single type of safeguard.
Effective security strategies deliberately combine multiple categories and control types to address both human and technical risks.
